answers.answer: With a BP like that it's necessary. If it goes any higher you can have seizures possible stroke and other complications. It's a risk at 36 weeks but a lot of newborns come out just fine. There are test to make sure baby's lungs are developed well and other organs that would be my only concern.

Baby will be just fine! I had horrible bp problems with my last son starting at 27weeks and was on meds until it got out of control had him at 37 weeks via csec. Perfect 7 lb 1oz 20 and a half inch. He's now a perfect lil 11 month old doing great been walking since 9 months and hitting all other stages just fine. Keeping baby in can be more harmful with it being that high.

I was induced with my daughter at 36 wks due to high blood pressure.  Was in labor for 39 hrs and my daughter had to be resuscitated at birth. However, she is perfect and I do not regret being induced.  My bp got so high I could have lost her and myself.
At 36 weeks your considerd full term so dont worry
I think I'd go for the induction too.  Protein in the urine one time and those bp numbers are worrisome  And baby is nice and big (well, pretty big for 36 + weeks)  good luck sweetie

I was induced at 36 weeks +2 for pre eclamsia and my son was pretty healthy, he had to stay in the NICU for fluid in his lungs and jaundice but he was fine and we got to the take him home within a week. It was scary at the time but things could have gotten a lot worse if I didn't get induced.

question: So the last few weeks when I go to the doctor my blood pressure is high (can hit 160/110) so each time he sends me to l&d blood work is normal and the last visit was the only visit without protein in my urine. He said he could induce me on Tuesday which would make me 36+4. At last visit baby was measuring 7.7 lbs. I have also lost my mucus plug. I also have gestational diabetes.  My question is would u be ok woth inducing this early. I am afraid to make the wrong decision.  My last visit which was Thursday he said he would give me the choice but not so sure of my next visit which is Tues.
title: high blood pressure
